com.jswiff.swfrecords.tags
Class DefineFont2

java.lang.Object
  com.jswiff.swfrecords.tags.Tag
      com.jswiff.swfrecords.tags.DefinitionTag
          com.jswiff.swfrecords.tags.DefineFont2
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefineFont3
public class DefineFont2
extends DefinitionTag

This tag is used to supply font information. Unlike with DefineFont, fonts defined with this tag can be used for dynamic text. Font metrics for improved layout can be supplied. Mapping to device fonts is also possible.

Since:
SWF 3.
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

DefineFont2

public DefineFont2(int characterId,
                   java.lang.String fontName,
                   Shape[] glyphShapeTable,
                   char[] codeTable)

Creates a new DefineFont2 tag. Requires the font's character ID and name, a glyph shape table and a code table.

The shape table contains one shape for each glyph. When using dynamic device text, the shape table can be empty (set to null). In this case, the code table is ignored.

The code table is an array of characters equal in size to the shape table. It assigns a character to each glyph.

Parameters:
characterId - character ID of the font
fontName - font name, either direct, e.g. 'Times New Roman', or indirect, like '_serif'
glyphShapeTable - array of shapes (for each glyph one)
codeTable - array of chars (for each glyph one)
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if code table is different from glyph count

public short getDescent()
Returns the font's descent. The descent is the space below the baseline required by the lowest descender (distance between base line and descender line).

Returns:
font descent (in EM square coords)

Returns:
true if set, else false

setLayout

public void setLayout(short ascent,
                      short descent,
                      short leading,
                      short[] advanceTable,
                      Rect[] boundsTable,
                      KerningRecord[] kerningTable)

Sets layout information for dynamic glyph text.

The ascent is the distance from the baseline to the ascender line (i.e. to the highest ascender of the font).

The descent is the space below the baseline required by the lowest descender.

The leading is the spacing between descender and ascender line of two successive lines (vertical line spacing).

This method allows the specification of a bounds table and a kerning table. Supply arrays equal in size to the glyph count (which is determined by the size of the glyph shape table), or use null to simplify matters.

Parameters:
ascent - font ascender height (in EM square coords)
descent - font descender height (in EM square coords)
leading - vertical spacing between lines (from descender to next line's ascender, in EM square coords)
advanceTable - advance values (for each glyph one, in EM square coords)
boundsTable - glyph bounds table
kerningTable - kerning table
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if size of boundsTable or kerningTable is not equal to glyph count

setShiftJIS

public void setShiftJIS(boolean shiftJIS)
Sets the value of the shiftJIS flag. If shiftJIS is set, then ANSI is cleared. If neither ANSI nor shiftJIS are set, UCS-2 is used.

Parameters:
shiftJIS - true if flag set, else false

setSmallText

public void setSmallText(boolean smallText)
Sets the value of the smallFont flag. When this flag is set, the font is optimized for small text (anti-aliasing is disabled).

Parameters:
smallText - true if flag set, else false
